title: Med Tech Interview

Interview Questions: Do you prefer to work independently or part of a team? Strengths/Weaknesses One thing that would make me remember you.

Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Why Eskaton

Interview Descriptions: Very long arduous process, must complete background check and physical and then drug test and tb test after the interview in order to get hired at any one of these facilities

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Eskaton (Sacramento, CA) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions. Asking about past experience. They will have you walk into the facility to fill out an application so bring a copy of your resume to fill out paperwork.

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Eskaton (Sacramento, CA) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: Panel of two people, they write down your answers. They called me two days later to let me know I got the job. I had to get a physical and they send you to corporate office.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about calling into work?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Eskaton (Sacramento, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an online application. After a few weeks, I received a phone call to schedule an in-person interview. After the in-person interview, I received a call a few weeks later to attend orientation.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations?

title: Resident Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Eskaton (Roseville, CA) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took long.  I had two interviews one with the Executive Director and the nurses and another one with all the directors.  In hindsight thought I would not have changed anything.  I feel that I had an insight on my co-workers before even working and that has help me adjust and fit in nicely.
Interview Questions: Mainly experience and regarding my resume.  But what stood out was that they asked me what I did outside of work.  That is surprising to me because I felt that they not only cared about what I could bring to the table but what I did outside of work was also important.

title: Leadership Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Eskaton (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: After completing a very brief phone interview, I was invited on site for an in-person interview with the hiring manager.  I was called a few days later and offered the position.  However, I declined because it was not a good fit for me.  Also, I would be remiss if I did mention that this was the second job I applied for at Eskaton.  The first time I applied was for the same position at a different location.  I was not invited to interview.  In lieu of not responding to my application at all or simply sending me a standard notification email, I received a form postcard informing me that another candidate was selected for the position. While I think sending a decision in the mail still has merits in the 21st century, despite being somewhat old fashioned, a postcard is tacky and distasteful because it does not protect candidate confidentiality.  Anyone who handled the postcard prior to its delivery was privy to the information.  Occasionally, I receive a neighbor’s mail by accident, and vice versa.  I would have been extremely embarrassed if one of my neighbors had received this postcard.  I recommend that Eskaton stop sending these form, impersonal postcards immediately.  Instead, I recommend that the company either send a letter in a confidential envelop or just send an email like most other employers.  Even not responding to a candidate that took the time to apply for an open position would be better than a postcard.
Interview Questions: What led you to apply for this position?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Eskaton (Fair Oaks, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Warm interview with director of program.  Very casual and made me feel welcome.  The interview lasted about 30 minutes total and they were responsive to questions from me.  They let me know in a timely fashion when I was selected for the position

title: Dietary Aid Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Eskaton (Cameron Park, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was first called in for a one-on-one interview with the Food Service Director, then upon her approval I was called in for a second panel interview with a couple of the other managers. After that, I went through a background check, drug test, and a physical, all paid for by the company.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Eskaton (Sacramento, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Filled out application in the facility. Got a call back with in a couple days. If you are looking to apply here your best bet is to go into what ever facility you want to work at and turn in your application there along with your resume
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work here? Along with many patient scenarios such as what would you do if you needed help but couldn't leave the patient?

title: Wait Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Eskaton (Carmichael, CA) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: it was very brief, they had at least two supervisors simulataneously ask me questions, mainly about my temperment and how I would deal with unruly or not very friendly residents. asked a lot about how i would deal with specific situations concerning the residents not so much on how i would get along with the staff. overall asked very general questions such as why im applying for such a position or what qualities i have that could give an overall friendly experience for the staff working there
Interview Questions: how would you deal with residents that weren't as kind or were rude?

title: Office Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Eskaton (Fair Oaks, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is two stages you meet with the supervisor of what area they are hiring for as a meet and greet the next stage is the panel interview of five of the supervisors.
Interview Questions: If I had all the money in the world what would I do with it?

title: Activity Director Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Eskaton (Sacramento, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Face to face with administrator, submission of cover letter and resume, review of references, background check and drug screen, second interview, meeting with second interview panel, there is nothing else to write so I have no idea why you are forcing me to write 30 words or more!
Interview Questions: Do you have experience doing MDS?
